# OIAN
![Prevertebral muscles anterior view @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020](/Alchemy Archive/Anatomy/OIANs/images/prevertebral mm fig3.7b gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020.png){#fig-prevertebralmm_ant}

| Longus Colli Cervicis  | Origin  | Insertion | Nerve | Action |
|--------|----------|-----------|-------|--------|
| Vertical Part | C5-T3 (ant side of vertebral body) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 | Occipital bone (basilar part) | Direct branches from cervical plexus (C2-C6) | Bilaterally flexes AO Joint; Unilaterally flexes and slight I/L rotation |
| Superior Oblique part | C3-C5 (TP, Ant tubercle) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 | Superior oblique part: C1 (TP, ant tubercle) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 |  |  |
| Inferior Oblique Part | T1-T3 (ant side of vertebral body) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 | Inferior oblique part: C5-C6 (TP, Ant tubercles) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 |  |  |

## Origin

- C5-T3 (ant side of vertebral body) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020
- C3-C5 (TP, Ant tubercle) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020
- T1-T3 (ant side of vertebral body) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

## Insertion

Vertical (medial) part: C2-C4 (ant sides of vertebral bodies) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020
Superior oblique part: C1 (TP, ant tubercle) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020
Inferior oblique part: C5-C6 (TP, Ant tubercles) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

## Innervation
Direct branches from cervical plexus (C2-C6) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

## Action

- **Bilateral**: Flex AO Joint
- **Unilateral**: Lat flex at AO joint

# Muscle groups
Longus colli cervicis is part of the prevertebral muscle group @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020.
